Watercolor Smoother Felix

watercolor_smoother_felix.Rd

This function creates a visually regression smoother, also called a Watercolor plot. The initial idea came from Solomon Hsiang. Felix Schonbrodt provided inital syntax based on Solomon's idea, and with additional inputfrom many blog commenters. He licensed this with a FreeBSD License (see syntax).

watercolor_smoother_felix(formula, data, title = "", B = 1000,
  shade = TRUE, shade.alpha = 0.1, spag = FALSE,
  spag.color = "darkblue", mweight = TRUE, show.lm = FALSE,
  show.median = TRUE, median.col = "white", show.points = FALSE,
  shape = 21, show.CI = FALSE, method = loess, bw = FALSE,
  slices = 200, palette = RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(9, "YlGnBu"),
  ylim = NULL, quantize = "continuous", add = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

B

Number of bootstrapped smoothers. The default is 1000.
shade

Logical value indicating whether to plot the shaded confidence region. The default is TRUE.
shade.alpha

Numercial value indicating the degree to which the confidence enevelope shading should fade out at the edges. This reduces the alpha value. (0 = no alpha decrease, 0.1 = medium alpha decrease, 0.5 = strong alpha decrease)
spag

Logical value indicating whether the bootstrapped spaghetti lines should be plotted. The default is FALSE.
spag.color

Color of bootstrapped spaghetti lines.
mweight

Logical value indicating whether the median smoother should be visually weighted. The default is TRUE.
show.lm

Logical value indicating whether the linear regresison line should be plotted. The default is FALSE.
show.median

Logical value indicating whether the median smoother should be plotted. The default is TRUE.
median.col

Color of the median smoother.
show.points

Logical value indicating whether to plot the observed data. The default is FALSE.
shape

Shape of points. The default is 21 (open circles). This is only relevant if show.points=TRUE.
show.CI

Logical value indicating whether the 95 envelope should be plotted. Default is FALSE.
method

the fitting function for the spaghettis; default: loess
bw

Logical value indicating whether to use a black-and-white palette. The default is FALSE.
slices

Number of slices in x and y direction for the shaded region. Higher numbers make a smoother plot, but takes longer to draw. I would not go beyond 500.
palette

Color palette for the shading in the confidence envelope. This defaults to the 9-color YlGnBu palette from RColorBrewer.
ylim

Set y-limit to restrict the range of the watercoloring. The default is NULL.
quantize:

Character string indicating the type of shading on the confidence envelope. The default is "continuous", which uses a continuous color gradient across the entire range of y. Setting this to "SD" we get three color regions for 1, 2, and 3 SD (an idea of John Mashey)
add:

Logical value indicating whether to return a new ggplot. The default is FALSE. If add = TRUE, only the elements are returned, which can be added to another ggplot (with the '+' operator)
...:

Further parameters passed to the fitting function, in the case of loess, for example, "span = .9", or "family = 'symmetric'"

Value

A ggplot object giving the watercolor plot

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value

Developed by Andrew Zieffler.
